page.title: 02FARMING IN CENTRAL SCOTLAND
page.content: MOST FARMS IN {CENTRAL SCOTLAND}ARE DOWN IN A{VALLEY.}OUR AREA IS THE { {CENTRAL BELT}OF SCOTLAND.THE FARMS ARE MAINLY SMALL FARMS,THEY ARE ABOUT{150 {ACRES}IN SIZE.THEY ARE{MIXED}FARMS WITH GRASS,HAY,AND BARLEY.THEY ALSO HAVE DAIRY AND BEEF CATTLE.THEY DO NOT HAVE A LOT OF SHEEP FARMING.THE FARMERS DON'T SHARE THEIR MACHINERY BUT THEY RENT OUT THEIR FIELDS TO OTHER FARMERS. THE FARMERS HAVE THEIR{ {PROBLEMS}LIKE THE PRICE OF MACHINERY HAS GONE UP,SO HAS FOOD FOR THE ANIMALS ,FERTIILIZERS,AND RATES.THE MARKET PRICE FOR PRODUCE HAS NOT GONE UP AS MUCH.THE FARMERS' EMPLOYEES' WAGES HAVE GONE UP.THE { {E.E.C.}DOES NOT ENCOURAGE FARMERS TO PRODUCE TOO MUCH BARLEY AND HAY.
